section.title: Overview
section.para: This module collects extensions from &kamailio; TM module.

&kamailio; TM (Transaction Management) module documentation is available at:
http://www.kamailio.org/docs/modules/1.5.x/tm.html

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
tm - transaction management.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None.
Cancel branches of an active SIP transaction. The function can be called for a SIP reply that will identify the current branch.
Parameter can be:.

listitem.para: all - cancel all branches.
others - cancel all branches but the current one.
this - cancel current branch.

section.para: This function can be used in ONREPLY_ROUTE.
Cancel first INVITE transaction identified by callid and cseq. It sets the flag if the value is greater than zero
Parameters:.

listitem.para: callid - call-id value.
cseq - cseq number.
flag - index of the flag to set.

section.para: This function can be used in ANY_ROUTE.
Send reply to first INVITE transaction identified by callid and cseq.
Parameters:.

listitem.para: callid - call-id value.
cseq - cseq number.
code - reply code.
reason - reply reason.

section.para: This function can be used in ANY_ROUTE.

Flush the flags from current SIP message into the already created transaction. It make sense only in routing block if the transaction was created via t_newtran() and the flags have been altered since.
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE .

section.title: Exported pseudo-variables
section.para: Exported pseudo-variables are documented at &kamwikilink;.
Generates and sends a local SIP request.
Parameters:

listitem.para: method - request method
RURI - request SIP URI
NEXT HOP - next hop SIP URI (OBP); use . if no value.
socket - local socket to be used for sending the request; use . if no value.
headers - set of additional headers to be added to the request; at least From and To headers must be specify)
body - (optional, may not be present) request body (if present, requires the Content-Type and Content-length headers)

section.para: Generates and sends a CANCEL for an existing local SIP request.
Parameters:

listitem.para: callid - callid of the INVITE request to be cancelled.
cseq - cseq of the INVITE request to be cancelled.

section.para: Gets information about the load of TM internal hash table.
Parameters:
Generates and sends a reply for an existing inbound SIP transaction.
Parameters:

listitem.para: code - reply code
reason - reason phrase.
trans_id - transaction identifier (has the hash_entry:label format)
to_tag - To tag to be added to TO header
body - (optional, may not be present) reply body (if present, requires the Content-Type and Content-length headers)

section.title: Exported statistics
section.para: Exported statistics are listed in the next sections. All statistics except inuse_transactions can be reset.

section.title: received_replies
section.para: Total number of total replies received by TM module.

section.title: relayed_replies
section.para: Total number of replies received and relayed by TM module.

section.title: local_replies
section.para: Total number of replies local generated by TM module.

section.title: UAS_transactions
section.para: Total number of transactions created by received requests.

section.title: UAC_transactions
section.para: Total number of transactions created by local generated requests.

section.title: 2xx_transactions
